channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: White House insists Trump’s prosecutor was legally appointed after federal judge throws out Comey and James indictments – live

item.title: Australia politics live: Ley says Hanson’s burqa stunt ‘cheapens our parliament’
item.description: Meanwhile Tanya Plibersek calls on governments and services to do more to protect victims of domestic violence. Follow today’s news live Get our break...

item.title: Ukraine makes significant changes to US ‘peace plan’, sources say

item.title: Nigel Farage’s shifting answers on school-days racism claims – a timeline

item.title: Council votes to change street named after former prince
item.description: Councillors in Mid and East Antrim have voted to change the name of a road called Prince Andrew Way in Carrickfergus.

item.title: Farage says he's 'never directly racially abused anybody' after school racism claims
item.description: The Reform UK leader was responding to reports he made racist remarks to his peers in school in the 1970s.

item.title: Five key moments after MPs question top BBC figures
item.description: BBC chairman Samir Shah, alongside board members and former advisers, appears before MPs after the resignation of Tim Davie.

item.title: Everton's Gueye sent off for clash with team-mate Keane
item.description: Everton's Idrissa Gana Gueye is sent off for clashing with team-mate Michael Keane during the Premier League match at Manchester United.
